messageBody:
Hi "JUnit Headache" :-)

What you are describing sounds more like Design by Contract (DBC) than TDD
(they are not mutually exclusive, by the way).

Overall, DBC hasn't gained much traction in the software world, for a bunch
of reasons (some detailed here <http://www.jroller.com/page/cbeust/20021213>
).

As for your approach, it suffers from a couple of drawbacks:

- It violates the Don't Repeat Yourself principle: the code for
testing is repeated in both the method and the test method
- It forces developers to write code in comments, which is easy to
break.

This doesn't mean you shouldn't go ahead and do it: learning by example is
what school projects are all about...

--
Cedric
http://testng.org

>
> }
> given a comment like the above will generate assert statements such

> assertTrue(isLegalInt(1));
> assertTrue(isLegalInt(9));
> assertFalse(isLegalInt(10));
>
> Thus, I am trying to locate the source code that generates the
